intro: Antirrhinum coulterianum f. orcuttianum, commonly known as the Orcutt's snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has slender, branched stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its botanical features make it a notable species for both horticultural interest and ecological studies.
